title: Replaced

en: Having spent the week working on a client's job, you get it finished and send it in - only to be informed they hired someone else and won't be paying you for the work, "since they won't be using it."

no_caption: It's not worth raising a fuss over.

en: The client responds with a sassy e-mail, declaring that you didn't sign a contract and the sparse verbal one you agreed to guaranteed payment only upon use of the asset in question. Still, they send you $100 - probably to keep you quiet.
It's not something you're happy about, but when you've already wasted this much time and energy on them, there's no reason to waste more.
You still leave a scathing - and anonymous - review for them online, though.
